    • Field Detail

      • logger

        protected static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger

      • FETCH_HITS_MIN

        protected static final int FETCH_HITS_MIN
        Minimum number of hits to fetch in an ensureHitsRead() block. This prevents locking again and again for a single hit when iterating. See HitsFromQuery and HitsFiltered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • capturedGroups

        protected CapturedGroupsImpl capturedGroups
        Our captured groups, or null if we have none.

      • hitsCounted

        protected int hitsCounted
        The number of hits we've seen and counted so far. May be more than the number of hits we've retrieved if that exceeds maxHitsToRetrieve.

      • docsRetrieved

        protected int docsRetrieved
        The number of separate documents we've seen in the hits retrieved.

      • docsCounted

        protected int docsCounted
        The number of separate documents we've counted so far (includes non-retrieved hits).

      • fromSpanQuery

        public static Hits fromSpanQuery(QueryInfo queryInfo,
                                 BLSpanQuery query,
                                 SearchSettings searchSettings)
                          throws WildcardTermTooBroad
        Construct a Hits object from a SpanQuery.
        Parameters:
        queryInfo - information about the original query
        query - the query to execute to get the hits
        searchSettings - settings such as max. hits to process/count
        Returns:
        hits found
        Throws:
        WildcardTermTooBroad - if a wildcard term matches too many terms in the index

                            List<Hit> hits)
        Make a wrapper Hits object for a list of Hit objects. Does not copy the list, but reuses it.
        Parameters:
        queryInfo - information about the original query
        hits - the list of hits to wrap, or null for empty Hits object
        Returns:

      • window

        public Hits window(int first,
                   int windowSize)
        Get a window into this list of hits. Use this if you're displaying part of the resultset, like in a paging interface. It makes sure BlackLab only works with the hits you want to display and doesn't do any unnecessary processing on the other hits. HitsWindow includes methods to assist with paging, like figuring out if there hits before or after the window.
        Specified by:
        window in class Results<Hit>
        Parameters:
        first - first hit in the window (0-based)
        windowSize - size of the window
        Returns:
        the window

      • collocations

        public TermFrequencyList collocations(Annotation annotation,
                                      ContextSize contextSize,
                                      MatchSensitivity sensitivity,
                                      boolean sort)
        Count occurrences of context words around hit.
        Parameters:
        annotation - what annotation to get collocations for
        contextSize - how many words around the hits to use
        sensitivity - what sensitivity to use
        sort - sort the resulting collocations by descending frequency?
        Returns:
        the frequency of each occurring token

      • collocations

        public TermFrequencyList collocations(Annotation annotation,
                                      ContextSize contextSize,
                                      MatchSensitivity sensitivity)
        Count occurrences of context words around hit. Sorts the results from most to least frequent.
        Parameters:
        annotation - what annotation to get collocations for
        contextSize - how many words around the hits to use
        sensitivity - what sensitivity to use
        Returns:
        the frequency of each occurring token

      • collocations

        public TermFrequencyList collocations(Annotation annotation,
                                      ContextSize contextSize)
        Count occurrences of context words around hit. Matches case- and diacritics-sensitively, and sorts the results from most to least frequent.
        Parameters:
        annotation - what annotation to get collocations for
        contextSize - how many words around the hits to use
        Returns:
        the frequency of each occurring token

      • window

      • sort

        public <P extends ResultProperty<Hit>> Hits sort(P sortProp)
        Return a new Hits object with these hits sorted by the given property. This keeps the existing sort (or lack of one) intact and allows you to cache different sorts of the same resultset. The hits themselves are reused between the two Hits instances, so not too much additional memory is used.
        Specified by:
        sort in class Results<Hit>
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property to sort on
        Returns:
        a new Hits object with the same hits, sorted in the specified way

                                 ConcordanceType type)

      • kwics

        public Kwics kwics(ContextSize contextSize)

      • maxStats

        public abstract MaxStats maxStats()
        Did we exceed the maximum number of hits to process/count? NOTE: this is only valid for the original Hits instance (that executes the query), and not for any derived Hits instance (window, sorted, filtered, ...). The reason that this is not part of QueryInfo is that this creates a brittle link between derived Hits instances and the original Hits instances, which by now may have been aborted, leaving the max stats in a frozen, incorrect state.
        Returns:
        our max stats, or MaxStats.NOT_EXCEEDED if not available for this instance

      • numberOfResultObjects

        public int numberOfResultObjects()
        Description copied from interface: SearchResult
        How many result objects does this search store? Used for estimating the cache size. Hits make up most of the storage of results objects, and they should take 24 bytes of memory, so we can use this number to make a reasonable approximation of memory usage. Note that this number can be misleading, because Hit objects are shared between results objects. But it's the best we have at the moment.
        Returns:
        how many hits are stored in this result object
